title: Alexandra Daddario is a vampy vision in a black gown featuring webbed
text:
She's just finished filming two new feature films - 1 Night in San Diego and Lost Girls and Love Hotels.

And Alexandra Daddario made her star shine even brighter as she was seen at the 2019 amfAR Inspiration Gala in LA.

The Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters star, 33, donned a vampy black gown with transparent sleeves made of knitted webbing.

Dark: And Alexandra Daddario made her star shine even brighter as she was seen at the 2019 amfAR Inspiration Gala in LA

She turned up the drama with dark black liner, balancing it out with a sheer lip gloss.

Daddario accessorized with a thin gold chain with a single pendant and a pair of heels that featured a combination of materials including snakeskin and sequins.

The 5ft 8in beauty stars in the new CBS thriller Why Women Kill alongside Lucy Liu, Ginnifer Goodwin, Reid Scott and Kirby Howell-Baptiste.

Gorgeous: The Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters star, 33, donned a vampy black gown with transparent sleeves made of knitted webbing

Picture perfect: The 5ft 8in beauty stars in the new CBS thriller Why Women Kill alongside Lucy Liu, Ginnifer Goodwin, Reid Scott and Kirby Howell-Baptiste

Truthful: She recently opened up to The Hollywood Reporter on her feelings towards the ongoing project, saying - 'It portrays three different women who are dealing with betrayal and how they deal with betrayal in different time periods and how it’s changed and how it hasn’t changed, and it’s really funny'

She recently opened up to The Hollywood Reporter on her feelings towards the ongoing project, saying: 'It portrays three different women who are dealing with betrayal and how they deal with betrayal in different time periods and how it’s changed and how it hasn’t changed, and it’s really funny.'

Daddario also shared her feelings on the 'thriple' relationship that her character finds herself in with Howell-Baptiste and Scott's characters.

'It’s an open relationship, which I’ve never personally been in so it was really fun to explore what that might be like, and I have friends who are in those kinds of relationships, and I think that either they’re becoming more common or people are discussing them more, being more open about them,' she told the outlet.

Honest: Daddario also shared her feelings on the 'thriple' relationship that her character finds herself in with Howell-Baptiste and Scott's characters

When asked what's next for the show, she replied, 'it gets really juicy.'

'The whole show, you don’t know which way it’s going to twist and turn and it gets really, really exciting, so it’s one of those things where every single episode is a cliffhanger and you want to know what happens next and you won’t expect what’s going to happen next,' she divulged.

Daddario was engaged to fellow actor Logan Lerman from 2015-2016.

She's been dating Emma Watson's ex-boyfriend Brendan Wallace at least since April.
description: She's just finished filming two new feature films - 1 Night in San Diego and Lost Girls and Love Hotels.
